item.title: Server-Side Request Forgery
item.description: Server-side request forgery (SSRF) is a vulnerability that lets an attacker send requests on behalf of a server. During an SSRF, attackers forge the request signatures of the vulnerable server, allowing them to assume a privileged position on a network, bypass firewall controls, and gain access to internal services. References SSRF (Server Side Request Forgery) AllAboutBugBounty/Server Side Request Forgery.md at master · daffainfo/AllAboutBugBounty bugbounty-cheatsheet/ssrf.md at master · EdOverflow/bugbounty-cheatsheet HowToHunt/SSRF at master · KathanP19/HowToHunt
